Develop performance guarantees (PGs) and Service Level Agreements (SLAs), manage and ensure adherence to vendor contracts. Work closely with internal and external data analytics consultant(s) to review program metrics and ROI results, identify cost saving opportunities and to understand trends to predict future needs. Compliance: Ensure vendors are administering benefit plans in accordance with regulatory and legal compliance. Maintains knowledge of various state and federal laws that impact in-scope benefit programs. Ensure that vendor processes are compliant through both internal and external audits.
Health & Wellbeing Program/Partner Identification: Identify new benefits/programs that support the overall goals and objectives of the Health and Wellbeing function. Manage RFPs, RFIs, market checks and audits in collaboration with internal peers and external consulting partners.
General Employee Benefits Support: Act in a consulting-type relationship with internal/external partners to share knowledge, drive strategy decisions, and make recommendations. May collaborate with Communications to create and lead benefit education webinars. Actively participate in benefit-related organizations representing the company's interests. Act as a resource to team members for problem solving. Lead/ support other ad-hoc projects and perform other responsibilities as required.

Minimum Requirements
Bachelor's degree in a business-related field or an equivalent combination of education and relevant experience.
Eight years of progressively responsible benefits management experience and two years of vendor management experience, including in-depth knowledge of medical and pharmacy benefits issues, trends and practices preferred.
Strong leadership, planning and organizational skills; demonstrated ability to make solid business judgments and provide guidance on priorities and technical implementation; and proven interpersonal and communication skills to effectively interface with individuals and groups at all levels of both internal and external organizations.
Must have experience related to medical plan management.
Pharmacy plan management experience is preferred.
Current benefits certification through a recognized professional or educational organization is preferred.
As a leading combination electricity and natural gas energy company, Xcel Energy offers a comprehensive portfolio of energy-related products and services to 3.4 million electricity and 1.9 million natural gas customers across eight Western and Midwestern states. At Xcel Energy, we strive to be the preferred and trusted provider of the energy our customers need. If you’re ready to be a part of something big, we invite you to join our team.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
Individuals with a disability who need an accommodation to apply please contact us at recruiting@xcelenergy.com.
Non-Bargaining
The anticipated starting base pay for this position is: $92,300.00 to $130,566.66 per year
This position may also be eligible for the following benefits and/or pay components: Pay - Annual Incentive Program, Medical/Pharmacy Plan, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Dependent Care Reimbursement Account, Health Care Reimbursement Account, Health Savings Account (HSA) (if enrolled in eligible health plan), Limited-Purpose FSA (if enrolled in eligible health plan and HSA), Transportation Reimbursement Account, Short-term disability (STD), Long-term disability (LTD), Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Fitness Center Reimbursement (if enrolled in eligible health plan), Tuition reimbursement, Transit programs, Employee recognition program, Pension, 401(k) plan, Paid time off (PTO), Holidays, Personal holidays, Volunteer Paid Time Off (VPTO) (full-time employees only), Parental Leave
Pay and benefit packages may vary based on position. Some employees are under collective bargaining agreements, which determine the benefits they will receive. If the information conflicts with the terms of the written plan documents governing the plan, the plan document will control. Benefit plans are subject to change and Xcel Energy has the right to end, suspend, or amend any of its plans, at any time, in whole or in part.
Deadline to Apply: 03/12/24
EEO is the Law | EEO is the Law Supplement | Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination | Equal Opportunity Policy (PDF) | Employee Rights (PDF)
ACCESSIBILITY STATEMENT
Xcel Energy endeavors to make https://www.xcelenergy.com/ accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact Xcel Energy Talent Acquisition at recruiting@xcelenergy.com. This contact information is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

title: Mission Strategy Consultant, Junior
description:
Mission Strategy Consultant, Junior
The Opportunity:
Whether it’s process improvement, performance measurement, or business management analysis, organizational change management comes down to one thing, learning how an organization works and making it better. Although many companies know where they want to go, getting there can be a challenge. Thankfully, that’s what you do, improve the systems that move entire organizations forward. It’s why we’re looking for someone like you—an Mission Strategy Consultant, who can help identify long-term goals and support the creation of the processes needed to achieve them.
This is an opportunity to have a direct impact. As a Mission Strategy Consultant, on our team, you’ll engage with clients at the senior level to help them understand their organization and crystallize their goals. You’ll need to ask the right questions to draw out your client’s objectives and vision. Your client will look to you to show them their organization from the outside. From unrealized potential to systemic challenges, you’ll provide your client with a holistic view of their organization, as well as the multiple paths they can take to modernize. As the strategy expert, you’ll identify and anticipate your client’s needs as you create their way forward. You’ll prepare and conduct business analyses, study needs assessments, requirements analysis or definition, and cost or benefit analyses to align business systems, solutions, and initiatives. You’ll prepare forecasts and analyze trends, reporting regulations, and business conditions. You’ll analyze metrics, performance measurements, requirements, reports, and recommendations for management, organizational structure, procedures, and business systems. Join us and lead change for the better.
Join us. The world can’t wait.
You Have:
Experience working with teams in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Experience using Microsoft Office applications, including Word, PowerPoint, and Excel
Ability to conduct research and analysis of industry best practices
TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph
Scheduled to obtain a bachelor's degree by May 2024
Nice If You Have:
Experience working with the U.S. federal government, military, or the intelligence community
Ability to overcome challenges and obstacles
Ability to solve complex problems with both traditional and out-of-the-box solutions
Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills
Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance with polygraph is required.
Create Your Career:
Grow With Us
Your growth matters to us—that’s why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career. With professional and leadership development opportunities like upskilling programs, tuition reimbursement, mentoring, and firm-sponsored networking, you can chart a unique and fulfilling career path on your own terms.
A Place Where You Belong
Diverse perspectives cultivate collective ingenuity. Booz Allen’s culture of respect, equity, and opportunity means that, here, you are free to bring your whole self to work. With an array of business resource groups and other opportunities for connection, you’ll build your community in no time.
Support Your Well-Being
Our comprehensive benefits package includes wellness programs with HSA contributions, paid holidays, paid parental leave, a generous 401(k) match, and more. With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we’ll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life—at work and at home.
Your Candidate Journey
At Booz Allen, we know our people are what propel us forward, and we value relationships most of all. Here, we’ve compiled a list of resources so you’ll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us.
Compensation
At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.
Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $49,800.00 to $102,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date.
Work Model
Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.
If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.
EEO Commitment
We’re an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change – no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

title: Consultant, CAT Risk
description:
Who Are We?
Taking care of our customers, our communities and each other. That’s the Travelers Promise. By honoring this commitment, we have maintained our reputation as one of the best property casualty insurers in the industry for over 160 years. Join us to discover a culture that is rooted in innovation and thrives on collaboration. Imagine loving what you do and where you do it.
Job Category
Data Analytics, Data Science
Compensation Overview
The annual base salary range provided for this position is a nationwide market range and represents a broad range of salaries for this role across the country. The actual salary for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. As part of our comprehensive compensation and benefits program, employees are also eligible for performance-based cash incentive awards.
Salary Range
$69,000.00 - $113,900.00
Target Openings
1
What Is the Opportunity?
At Travelers, we work to ensure our customers are covered when it matters most. To provide the best coverage possible, our Enterprise Catastrophe Risk Management team assesses the risk of financial loss due to natural and manmade catastrophes and risk reward analytics. As the Consultant, Catastrophe (CAT) Risk, you will contribute within an assigned team and on assigned projects, while developing your risk and insurance industry knowledge and building professional relationships across the enterprise.

Enterprise Catastrophe Strategy and Analysis team has an opening for a CAT consultant. This role will be responsible for data analytics and ongoing maintenance of a data repository and analytics platform. The ideal candidate would possess excellent data architecture and data management skills. This skillset includes a mastery of querying and extracting data in AWS Athena and MS SQL. A mastery of MS Excel and other MS office products used in analysis of large datasets. Having a solid understanding of Insurance coverages, and insurance principles is a must. The candidate must be capable of working collaboratively with our Technology partners to translate business strategies and initiatives into requirements and see the work through the lifecycle to implementation.
What Will You Do?
Collaborate to provide data analysis and clear requirements to the technology team to assist with the build of data and analytics platform.
Understand and communicate data analysis results to the team, and to non-technical team members.
Understanding CAT modeling concepts, and CAT model inputs and
outputs.
Possess basic knowledge of coverage application for both personal and commercial insurance, and understand the various financial structures and terms associated with these coverages.
Understanding and applying basic data auditing and data controls to ensure audit compliance and data accuracy.
Using your understanding of insurance coverages and principles, work with our business partners to enhance our data to drive better analytics and business decisions.
Provide support for reinsurance placement through data analytics, working with brokers to provide exposure data, and validate CAT model results.
Support catastrophe risk evaluation focused in one or more of the following: CAT model framework, monitoring aggregation profiles, development of catastrophe view of risk, and/or performing risk reward analysis.
Support a project(s) involved in one or more of the following: CAT underwriting strategy, development of hazard maps, and/or metric standards including data quality, data feed attributes, concentration metrics, and profitability ratios.
Maintain awareness of Data Repository & CAT Ecosystem for metrics, reports, and exposure data.
Refresh basic analytical analyses to understand issues, identify cause/effect relationships and may identify and create process efficiencies within assignments.
Perform other duties as assigned.
What Will Our Ideal Candidate Have?
One year of relevant analytics experience.
Basic knowledge of Microsoft suite, SQL, geospatial, statistical packages or other programs used to retrieve and analyze data.
Basic knowledge and understanding of Catastrophe Risk Modeling components including model output and metrics.
Ability to proactively manage time and prioritize multiple claims simultaneously.
Written and verbal communication skills with the ability to pay attention to detail and effectively covey information to peers.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
What is a Must Have?
Bachelor’s Degree in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics), Business, or a related field.
What Is in It for You?
Health Insurance: Employees and their eligible family members – including spouses, domestic partners, and children – are eligible for coverage from the first day of employment.
Retirement: Travelers matches your 401(k) contributions dollar-for-dollar up to your first 5% of eligible pay, subject to an annual maximum. If you have student loan debt, you can enroll in the Paying it Forward Savings Program. When you make a payment toward your student loan, Travelers will make an annual contribution into your 401(k) account. You are also eligible for a Pension Plan that is 100% funded by Travelers.
Paid Time Off: Start your career at Travelers with a minimum of 20 days Paid Time Off annually, plus nine paid company Holidays.
Wellness Program: The Travelers wellness program is comprised of tools and resources that empower you to achieve your wellness goals. In addition, our Life Balance program provides access to professional counseling services, life coaching and other resources to support your daily life needs. Through Life Balance, you’re eligible for five free counseling sessions with a licensed therapist.
Volunteer Encouragement: We have a deep commitment to the communities we serve and encourage our employees to get involved. Travelers has a Matching Gift and Volunteer Rewards program that enables you to give back to the charity of your choice.
Employment Practices
Travelers is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that we can deliver the very best products and services when our workforce reflects the diverse customers and communities we serve. We are committed to recruiting, retaining and developing the diverse talent of all of our employees and fostering an inclusive workplace, where we celebrate differences, promote belonging, and work together to deliver extraordinary results.

If you are a candidate and have specific questions regarding the physical requirements of this role, please send us an
email
so we may assist you.

Travelers reserves the right to fill this position at a level above or below the level included in this posting.
To learn more about our comprehensive benefit programs please visit
http://careers.travelers.com/life-at-travelers/benefits/
.

title: Senior Consultant, Data Management
description:
Who Are We?
Taking care of our customers, our communities and each other. That’s the Travelers Promise. By honoring this commitment, we have maintained our reputation as one of the best property casualty insurers in the industry for over 160 years. Join us to discover a culture that is rooted in innovation and thrives on collaboration. Imagine loving what you do and where you do it.
Job Category
Data Analytics
Compensation Overview
The annual base salary range provided for this position is a nationwide market range and represents a broad range of salaries for this role across the country. The actual salary for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. As part of our comprehensive compensation and benefits program, employees are also eligible for performance-based cash incentive awards.
Salary Range
$79,300.00 - $130,800.00
Target Openings
1
What Is the Opportunity?
At Travelers, we create trusted strategic products and services to unlock the power of our data. We enhance and measure our ability to access, govern, manage, connect and integrate internal and external data assets and ensure our employees understand the value of data and the impacts to our business. As a Sr Consultant, Data Management you will work on effective data governance practices to ensure that data is consistent, trustworthy, and doesn't get misused. You will measure accuracy, completeness, consistency, and reliability of data to embody and promote Traveler's data culture values. Consulting with business partners, you will drive the discussion to develop, implement, execute, and document data management, data governance, and metadata policies, standards, and best practices. Leveraging your understanding of the data ecosystem, business process and decision-making, and the data value chain, you will perform moderately complex root cause analysis to improve the quality of data.
What Will You Do?
Assist in the process of managing the availability, usability, integrity security and privacy of the data.
Implement processes to assure data quality for business purposes
Perform moderately complex data profiling and analysis and communicate results in support of data quality processes.
Meet with business customers to develop and maintain business data quality requirements and specifications.
Perform intermediate to advanced metadata documentation, data lineage, data transformation rules in support of key program deliverables.
Work with business customers to ensure appropriate naming definitions and standards are being followed.
Participate in the creation of data models (e.g., entity design and population).
Perform testing and validation of requirements and/or data management capabilities.
Demonstrate and apply detailed understanding of overall data models, data relationships, mapping lineage and business rules.
Create detailed test strategies and test plans.
Perform moderately complex root cause analysis and resolution of business data issues.
Gather information across the enterprise and use tools, processes, and workflows to capture knowledge and maintain its relevance.
Assist with the designing the creation, maintenance and governance of taxonomies and ensures its applicability to content and/or data.
Perform other duties as assigned.
What Will Our Ideal Candidate Have?
Experience SQL.
Experience with Python.
Experience with any BI Tool (MicroStrategy, Tableau, Qlik).
Cloud technology knowledge a plus.
Ability to understand metadata management, including metadata management, lineage, and cataloging.
Ability to clearly articulate thoughts and ideas and adjust communication based on audience.
Ability to leverage previous experience to consider a variety of alternatives to arrive at a timely, practical, and effective solution to resolve business problems.
Strong collaboration skills with the ability to work with business partners to design and execute priorities and project goals.
Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to handle shifting priorities.
Demonstrated understanding of overall data models, data relationships, mapping lineage and business rules.
What is a Must Have?
Bachelor’s degree or two years of relevant data and analytics, and/or data management experience.
What Is in It for You?
Health Insurance: Employees and their eligible family members – including spouses, domestic partners, and children – are eligible for coverage from the first day of employment.
Retirement: Travelers matches your 401(k) contributions dollar-for-dollar up to your first 5% of eligible pay, subject to an annual maximum. If you have student loan debt, you can enroll in the Paying it Forward Savings Program. When you make a payment toward your student loan, Travelers will make an annual contribution into your 401(k) account. You are also eligible for a Pension Plan that is 100% funded by Travelers.
Paid Time Off: Start your career at Travelers with a minimum of 20 days Paid Time Off annually, plus nine paid company Holidays.
Wellness Program: The Travelers wellness program is comprised of tools and resources that empower you to achieve your wellness goals. In addition, our Life Balance program provides access to professional counseling services, life coaching and other resources to support your daily life needs. Through Life Balance, you’re eligible for five free counseling sessions with a licensed therapist.
Volunteer Encouragement: We have a deep commitment to the communities we serve and encourage our employees to get involved. Travelers has a Matching Gift and Volunteer Rewards program that enables you to give back to the charity of your choice.
Employment Practices
Travelers is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that we can deliver the very best products and services when our workforce reflects the diverse customers and communities we serve. We are committed to recruiting, retaining and developing the diverse talent of all of our employees and fostering an inclusive workplace, where we celebrate differences, promote belonging, and work together to deliver extraordinary results.

If you are a candidate and have specific questions regarding the physical requirements of this role, please send us an
email
so we may assist you.

Travelers reserves the right to fill this position at a level above or below the level included in this posting.
To learn more about our comprehensive benefit programs please visit
http://careers.travelers.com/life-at-travelers/benefits/
.

title: Organizational Transformation and Change Consultant
description:
Organizational Transformation and Change Consultant
The Opportunity:
Whether it’s process improvement, performance measurement, or business management analysis, organizational change management comes down to one thing: learning how an organization works and making it better. Although many companies know where they want to go, getting there can be a challenge. Thankfully, that’s what you do: improve the systems that move entire organizations forward. It’s why we’re looking for an organizational transformation and change consultant like you who can help identify long-term goals and support the creation of the processes needed to achieve them.
This is an opportunity to create effectiveness and efficiency across public sector organizations. As a process improvement consultant, you’ll use your expertise to assess how alterations will impact business processes and design. From unrealized potential to systemic challenges, you’ll provide your client with a holistic view of their organization to transform their practices for the better.
Join us. The world can’t wait.
You Have:
1+ years of experience with strategic planning and execution, change management, and facilitation
Experience with planning and executing large projects, including the management of events or workshops
Ability to apply frameworks aligned to strategy for transformation efforts in the public sector
Ability to craft and deliver a compelling narrative to influence action on key business decisions and major change initiatives
Ability to obtain a security clearance
Ability to travel up to 25% of the time
Scheduled to obtain a Bachelor's degree by Spring or Summer 2024
Nice If You Have:
Experience with working in a highly collaborative, team-oriented environment
Experience with data analysis and visualization using Microsoft Excel, Tableau, or Power BI
Ability to develop presentations and work products using Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel
Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills
Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.
Create Your Career:
Grow With Us
Your growth matters to us—that’s why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career. With professional and leadership development opportunities like upskilling programs, tuition reimbursement, mentoring, and firm-sponsored networking, you can chart a unique and fulfilling career path on your own terms.
A Place Where You Belong
Diverse perspectives cultivate collective ingenuity. Booz Allen’s culture of respect, equity, and opportunity means that, here, you are free to bring your whole self to work. With an array of business resource groups and other opportunities for connection, you’ll build your community in no time.
Support Your Well-Being
Our comprehensive benefits package includes wellness programs with HSA contributions, paid holidays, paid parental leave, a generous 401(k) match, and more. With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we’ll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life—at work and at home.
Your Candidate Journey
At Booz Allen, we know our people are what propel us forward, and we value relationships most of all. Here, we’ve compiled a list of resources so you’ll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us.
Compensation
At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.
Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $49,800.00 to $102,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date.
Work Model
Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.
If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.
EEO Commitment
We’re an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change – no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

title: Customer Consulting Lead - Risk Intelligence
description:
Dynamic Role Overview:
As the Consulting Lead, you'll play a pivotal role in driving revenue and performance across LSEG Risk Intelligence solutions in the Americas. Leading an impactful team of consultants, you'll be instrumental in crafting a globalized vision and delivering standard methodologies for Customer Consulting. Collaborating with partners from various teams, you'll ensure alignment and an optimum client experience from pre-sales through implementation. This position, reporting to the Head of Customer Consulting Americas, is crucial to our success, ensuring timely, budget-conscious execution of company strategies.
Essential Responsibilities:
Lead all aspects of Risk Intelligence consulting team.
Consult and partner with team members to craft innovative solutions for our clients.
Implement strategies aligned with the Solutions Governance Framework, driving end-to-end sales and delivery efforts.
Partner with key contacts across departments to ensure collaboration and an excellent client experience.
Develop effective strategies, using regional capabilities and contributing to the Global Customer Consulting practice.
Offer expert knowledge to develop customized solutions using software development processes.
Guide and develop team members, driving inclusivity and teamwork.
Advocate for actions benefiting LSEG and the team in the long term, aligning with our Customer Consulting vision.
Important metrics:
Measure success through metrics like Gross Sales, Net Sales, Revenue, and Billable Utilization, ensuring alignment with sub-regional targets.
Leadership Responsibilities:
As the leader of the Risk Intelligence consulting team you would be a member of to the Americas Consulting leadership team and aligned to the overall Risk Intelligence leadership team.
Required Skills and Experience:
Experience leading teams with varied strengths, ideally within a matrix environment.
Extensive software consulting and project/program management experience.
Software delivery experience within the Risk sector.
Deep expertise of KYC, AML, identity and account verification industries.
Customer-centric focus with external client-facing experience.
Strong consultative approach and hands-on experience with Risk technologies and data solutions.
Shown experience leading pre sales and implementation consultants.
Track record of delivering or exceeding goals in a fast-paced sales environment.
Outstanding leadership and team development skills, driving unity and dedication.
Shown experience in driving equity and inclusivity.
Experience in delivering work from a global perspective.
High ability to influence key partners and leverage data and tools for decision-making.
Leadership Behaviors:
Reach out across the organization to promote expertise and diverse thinking.
Aspire for excellence, adopting agility and innovative solutions.
Communicate credibly and challenge traditional thinking.
Think strategically, positioning the organization for long-term success.
Demonstrate enterprise market awareness, including key industry issues and trends.
Join us in a role where your diverse skills and experiences will drive success for LSEG and our clients, crafting a future of inclusivity and collaboration.
Compensation/Benefits Information (New York applicants only):
LSEG is committed to offering competitive Compensation and Benefits. The anticipated base salary for this position is $140,300 - $260,700.
Compensation/Benefits Information (for all California based roles):
LSEG is committed to offering competitive Compensation and Benefits. The anticipated base salary for this position is $140,300 - $260,700.
Please be aware base salary ranges may vary by geographic location, city and state. In addition to our offered base salary, this role is eligible for our Annual Incentive Plan (AIP/”bonus plan”). Target AIP rates will be commensurate with role level and posted career stage. Individual salary will be reflective of job related knowledge, skills and equivalent experience. LSEG roles (excluding internships and part-time roles of less than 20 hours per week) are typically eligible for inclusion in our LSEG Benefits program, which includes offerings of: Annual Wellness Allowance, Paid time-off, Medical, Dental, Vision, Flex Spending & Health Savings Options, Prescription Drug plan, 401(K) Savings Plan and Company match. LSEG’s Benefits plan also includes basic life insurance, disability benefits, emergency backup dependent care, adoption assistance commuter assistance etc.
LSEG is a leading global financial markets infrastructure and data provider. Our purpose is driving financial stability, empowering economies and enabling customers to create sustainable growth.
Our purpose is the foundation on which our culture is built. Our values of Integrity, Partnership, Excellence and Change underpin our purpose and set the standard for everything we do, every day. They go to the heart of who we are and guide our decision making and everyday actions.
Working with us means that you will be part of a dynamic organisation of 25,000 people across 65 countries. However, we will value your individuality and enable you to bring your true self to work so you can help enrich our diverse workforce. You will be part of a collaborative and creative culture where we encourage new ideas and are committed to sustainability across our global business. You will experience the critical role we have in helping to re-engineer the financial ecosystem to support and drive sustainable economic growth. Together, we are aiming to achieve this growth by accelerating the just transition to net zero, enabling growth of the green economy and creating inclusive economic opportunity.
LSEG offers a range of tailored benefits and support, including healthcare, retirement planning, paid volunteering days and wellbeing initiatives.
We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. This means that we do not discriminate on the basis of anyone’s race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. Conforming with applicable law, we can reasonably accommodate applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs.

title: Senior Analytics Solution Consultant - Data Governance
description:
Description
Become part of an inclusive organization with over 40,000 diverse employees, whose mission is to improve the health and well-being of the unique communities we serve.
Summary:
As a Sr. Analytics Solution Consultant – Data Governance, you will be an integral part of the team responsible for driving data and analytics enablement through data governance efforts. These efforts include, but are not limited to, driving adoption of the data catalog, developing metadata management strategies, delivering data quality programs, and creating the policies and procedures to support them. Ultimately, these efforts enable our organization to leverage data as a strategic assets, supporting evidence-based decision-making and driving value.
The Sr. Analytics Solution Consultant – Data Governance is an emerging leader in the field of data governance, providing valuable support and insight within their assigned business or clinical domains of the healthcare system. This position serves as the internal customer account manager, working with both leaders and end users to characterize requirements and ensuring the successfully delivery of solutions to meet those needs. They help drive adoption of the data governance framework, developing meaningful relationships with stakeholders including, but not limited to, domain owners, data owners, data custodians, and data stewards. They are also responsible for day-to-day execution of data governance processes, including certifying data and analytics assets.
The Sr. Analytics Solution Consultant – Data Governance is an individual contributor that works under limited supervision and is comfortable both working on projects alone and leading more junior team members.
Responsibilities:
1. Strategic Mindset & Communication - The Sr. Analytics Solution Consultant – Data Governance is a versatile leader, equally fluent in communicating with senior executives and operations staff, and in orchestrating multidisciplinary teams through discussions into system-wide consensus. They build positive relationships with a wide range of leaders across the organization, and are conscious of long-term business goals. The Sr. Analytics Solution Consultant – Data Governance is both a strong presenter and listener. They are organizationally savvy, able to navigate overlapping or conflicting priorities across stakeholders. The Sr. Analytics Solution Consultant – Data Governance is adaptable, adjusting their approach to respond to the situation and the culture.
2. Enterprise Leadership, Mentorship & Training - Establishes and leads virtual teams of clinical, business, and information services staff from across the system to drive consensus on data and analytical needs and priorities. Mentors junior staff and analytics community members.
3. Program Management & Facilitation - The Sr. Analytics Solution Consultant – Data Governance leverages product and program management principles to drive the iterative creation of new data and analytical capabilities and assets for the system. This includes, but it not limited to consulting with business stakeholders to design and scope solutions, capturing and preparing project intake (demands), documenting business decisions, managing risks and scope, and updating customers on progress.
4. Delivery & Enablement - The Sr. Analytics Solution Consultant – Data Governance delivers analytical solutions and drives adoption with the business in order to achieve business objectives and realize value. They assess business adoption of delivered solutions. They provide end-user enablement and support, including high-touch customer service, communications, and the creation of reusable knowledge assets such as documentation and training content. The Sr. Analytics Solution Consultant – Data Governance serves as the liaison between their end-user community and developers, helping to identify, scope, and prioritize ongoing solution delivery.
Other Information
Education Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree required
Licensure/Certification Requirements: None
Professional Experience Requirements:
If a Bachelor’s Degree in a STEM field (i.e. Engineering, Math, Computer Science, Analytics, etc.), then two (2) years of experience is required
If a Bachelor's Degree in other field, requires four (4) years of experience.
If Master’s Degree, then two (2) years of experience is required.
If current certification in analytics, requires three (3) years of experience.
If an Associate's Degree, requires ten (10) years of experience.
If High School Diploma, requires twelve (12) years of experience.
Knowledge/Skills/and Abilities Requirements:
Ability to function with limited guidance and be comfortable working on projects alone or leading more junior team members.
Systemic transformation - considers reinvention of processes
Strategic - conscious of long term business goals
Strong presenter, listener (written and verbal communications)
Organizationally savvy, able to navigate overlapping or conflicting priorities across stakeholders
Manage project risks and scope
General awareness of the technology landscape
Exemplifies UNC Health System Values
Data Governance experience is required
Experience with data catalogs is required (i.e. Informatica, Collibra, Alation, data.world, Atlan, IBM Watson, Azure, Purview, Denodo, Cloudera, Qlik, etc.)
Experience with Metadata Management, Data Quality, Data Governance Policy and Procedure are all a plus

title: Business Solutions Consultant - Operations Support - Remote
description:
Job Description

Job Summary

Business Strategy Leader managing relationships and providing process expertise with Molina health plan leadership, corporate leadership, business subject matter experts (SMEs), business and IT operations partners, and Vendors. Manages new capability priorities. Leads business process improvement initiatives that result in operational efficiencies and/or an increase in customer satisfaction.

Job Duties

Builds, manages and maintains effective Business relationships with key stakeholders in business domain across Health plans and Corporate Healthcare functions,
Requires understanding of organization's business and industry requirements.
Focus is on process analysis and re-engineering, with a deep understanding of technical problems and solutions as they relate to the current and future business environment.
Drives process change by integrating new processes with existing ones or introducing modernization and communicating these changes to impacted business teams.
Uses quantitative and qualitative analysis to develop and improve internal processes across the enterprise.
Recommends and facilitates process improvement efforts. Will lead re-engineering team and act as project manager in some cases.
Drives efficiency: looks for and documents ways to increase the efficiency through continuous improvement goals.
Maintains management/technical skills that can be utilized in the field to solve complex problems.
Continuous improvements of established reports in production to ensure best performance and use for business value metrics.
Demonstrates use of tools, techniques and communications soft skills to build and maintain effective business relationships.
Works closely with Corporate leadership to deliver key business initiatives, process improvements, managing KPIs and business communication.
Assimilates and documents business needs for project requests and benefit value documentation including high level requirements, compliance implications and cost benefit analysis.
Organizes complex project requests or issue successfully into manageable approaches and advise on project set up/structure based on proposed scope.
Facilitates groups for problem solving and service improvement including definition/documentation, business workflow analysis.
Develops effective processes, forums and tracking mechanisms to continuously improve process through Business feedback, proactive handling of Business complaints and facilitation of resolution.
Conducts bi-weekly Operations and Issue Resolution meeting.
Maintains a Service Delivery Plan for individual Health plans or Corporate functions to include Business strategies/needs with corresponding IT strategies/plans, projects, performance measurements, customer satisfaction improvement plans and other items as determined by the health plan.
Effectively manages business escalations by ensuring appropriate accountability, sense of urgency, communication and follow through to closure.
Knowledgeable of State Medicaid contract Service Level Agreements. Demonstrates SME knowledge of MCO contract compliance requirements that impact processes.
Facilitates and leads processes and activities to complete deliverables impacting assigned healthplans including, but not limited to, RFP Responses, audit response/coordination, and evaluation of new contract requirements.
Other duties, as assigned.
Job Qualifications

REQU I RED ED U C A TI O N :
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Healthcare, Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent combination of education and experience
REQU I RED E X PE R I E N C E/KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:
6 - 8 years experience in Managed care, IT system delivery or related experience
Demonstrates Healthcare business process and/or functional knowledge.
Demonstrates use of effective communication skills
PR E FE R RED E X PE R I E N C E:
IT or system delivery or related experience.

Strategic planning experience.
Project management background.
PR E FE R RED L I C E N S E, C E R TI FI C A T I O N , AS S O C I A TI O N :

Six Sigma Black Belt, PMI - Project Management Professional, Agile Product Owner, Design Thinking Certification

title: Senior Claim Consultant
description:
Job Classification:
Project Mgmt, Transformation & Strategy - Project Mgmt, Transformation & Strategy
At Prudential, we believe talent is key to achieving our vision. When you join Prudential, you’ll unlock a motivating and impactful career – all while growing your skills and advancing your profession at one of the world’s leading financial services institutions!
As a Senior Claim Consultant for the Appeals / Litigation / Complaints organization in our Group Insurance business, you are responsible for driving operational improvements and leading the implementation of Strategic, Functional and Unit initiatives and projects. You will work with internal partners to identify and coordinate actions on operational improvement opportunities, make recommendations to influence claim operations, and provide technical oversight to claim professionals. The successful candidate will partner with their peer leadership group and contribute to the department’s overall success by engaging in continuous improvement. You will also support appropriate execution of claim management and decision making for disability appeals. This is an individual contributor role reporting to the Vice President, Appeals / Litigation / Complaints.
The current employee work arrangement for this position is fully virtual. While this position does not require your on-site presence on a regular basis, depending on business preferences, there may be occasions where you are required to be on-site at a Prudential office.
What you can expect:
Identify improvement areas and evaluate, develop, implement procedures to increase the efficiency and effectiveness of the department.
Lead the coordination of initiatives with the goal of increased overall effectiveness and efficiency of the department.
Serve as a Workstream Lead to support cross-functional projects and initiatives for GI Claims
Partners and leadership team to engage in continuous improvement.
Serve as a technical coach to help develop employees, with a focus on performance elevation.
Collaborate with key business partners, i.e. claim teams, learning & development, compliance, law, reporting team, etc. to jointly develop and implement strategic solutions.
May be involved with and / or conduct focus audits for unique claim components and account needs, with focus on claim management improvement.
Assist in reporting needs of Appeals, Litigation, and Complaints
Partner with peers to ensure proper claim management and decision making.
What you’ll need:
Incumbents typically have 8-10 years of experience in disability claims
Demonstrated leadership skills: solid communication, partnering, influencing and interpersonal skills
Proven results in continuous improvement and problem solving
A solid understanding of operational impacts resulting from initiative work, including reporting, KPIs and workflows
The ability to understand state and federal laws as they apply to claims practice
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Success in managing projects and initiatives
Strong critical thinking, problem solving, decision making and analytical skills
Working knowledge of Microsoft products; excel, PPT, etc.
It’d be a plus if you had:
Experience operationalizing regulatory changes and/or managing state market conduct activity is a plus
Prudential welcomes all applicants, even if you don't meet every requirement. If your skills align with the role, we encourage you to apply.
At Prudential, you can:
Take charge of your career. We equip and empower our employees to expand their skills and experience by using powerful learning, gigs, and job opportunities. We offer a suite of services including 1:1 Career advice, on demand resources and networking to propel your career forward.
We’re a global organization, full of outstandingly dedicated people who aren’t afraid to think differently, challenge the status quo and take sensible risks along the way. You will enjoy pushing boundaries as we build innovative technology that helps clients, customers and employees live their best lives. You will have access to leadership and learning opportunities and the resources needed to take your career in any direction. We will help you do your best work, offering flexibility, while delivering on our Purpose.
What we offer you:
Market competitive base salaries, with a yearly bonus potential at every level
Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance, Paid Time Off (PTO), and leave of absences, such as parental and military leave
Retirement plans: 401(k) plan with company match (up to 4%), company-funded pension plan
Wellness Programs to help you achieve your wellbeing goals, including up to $1,600 a year for reimbursement of items purchased to support personal wellbeing needs
Work/Life Resources to help support topics such as parenting, housing, senior care, finances, pets, legal matters, education, emotional and mental health, and career development.
Tuition Assistance to help finance traditional college enrollment toward obtaining an approved degree, many accredited certificate programs, and industry designations.
Employee Stock Purchase Plan: Shares can be purchased at 85% of the lower of two prices (Beginning or End of the purchase period), after one year of service.
To find out more about our Total Reward package, see our
Total Rewards Brochure
. Some of the above benefits may not apply to part-time employees scheduled to work less than 20 hours per week.
#LI-RRJ
Note: Prudential is required by state specific laws to include the salary range for this role when hiring a resident in applicable locations. The salary range for this role is from $107,200.00 to $159,500.00. Specific pricing for the role may vary within the above range based on many factors including geographic location, candidate experience, and skills. Roles may also be eligible for additional compensation and/or benefits. Eligibility to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program is subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance. In addition, employees are eligible for standard benefits package including paid time off, medical, dental and retirement.
Prudential Financial, Inc. of the United States is not affiliated with Prudential plc. which is headquartered in the United Kingdom.
Prudential is a multinational financial services leader with operations in the United States, Asia, Europe, and Latin America. Leveraging its heritage of life insurance and asset management expertise, Prudential is focused on helping individual and institutional customers grow and protect their wealth. The company's well-known Rock symbol is an icon of strength, stability, expertise and innovation that has stood the test of time. Prudential's businesses offer a variety of products and services, including life insurance, annuities, retirement-related services, mutual funds, asset management, and real estate services.
We recognize that our strength and success are directly linked to the quality and skills of our diverse associates. We are proud to be a place where talented people who want to make a difference can grow as professionals, leaders, and as individuals. Visit
www.prudential.com
to learn more about our values, our history and our brand.
Prudential is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetics, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, domestic partner status , medical condition or any other characteristic protected by law.
The Prudential Insurance Company of America, Newark, NJ and its affiliates.
Note that this posting is intended for individual applicants. Search firms or agencies should email Staffing at
staffingagencies@prudential.com
for more information about doing business with Prudential.
PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES:
If you need an accommodation to complete the application process, which may include an assessment, please email
accommodations.hw@prudential.com
.

title: NUTRITION EDUCATION CONSULTANT
description:
Job Description and Duties
Please note this is an 'Until Filled' position. The application cut-off date is March 7th, 2024, 11:59 PM (PST). Interested individuals must submit their application packages by the cut-off date to be considered.
It's an exciting time to join the Nutrition Services Division (NSD)! If you're passionate about child nutrition and wellness, join our team as we make history by supporting schools statewide to implement California's Universal Meal Program. We are looking for a dynamic, energetic, flexible, and committed nutrition education professional to join the Education and Nutrition Policy Unit-School Nutrition Programs (ENPU-SNP).

As a member of the ENPU-SNP, and under the direction of the Nutrition Education Administrator, this position supports the establishment of nutrition and food service education as an integrated component of a comprehensive school health system. This position serves as the subject matter expert for competitive foods, standardized recipe trainings, and the local school wellness policy. This position also provides leadership for communication of state and federal policy in these areas via trainings, resources, web content, and management bulletins. The position leads cross-division projects resulting from newly instituted legislation, develops and conducts statewide trainings on K-12 nutrition standards, and oversees funding opportunities including apportionments and local assistance grants and contracts.

This position is headquartered in Sacramento and may be eligible for a hybrid telework schedule for eligible applicants residing in the Sacramento area. A hybrid telework schedule includes working remotely and physically reporting to the office. This position requires up to 25 percent travel.
You will find additional information about the job in the Duty Statement.
Working Conditions
This position is headquartered in Sacramento and may be eligible for a hybrid telework schedule for eligible applicants residing in California. A hybrid telework schedule includes working remotely and physically reporting to the office.

Telework refers to all working days at approved alternate work location.

Job Code #:
JC-409826
Position #(s):
174-190-2261-XXX
Working Title:
Nutrition Education Consultant
Classification:
NUTRITION EDUCATION CONSULTANT
$7,764.00 - $9,718.00 A
Work Location:
Sacramento County
Telework:
Telework
Job Type:
Permanent, Full Time
Facility:
Nutrition Services Division
Department Information
The California Department of Education (CDE) oversees the state's diverse and dynamic public school system, which is responsible for the education of more than six million children and young adults in more than 10,000 schools with 295,000 teachers. The CDE and the State Superintendent of Public Instruction are responsible for enforcing education law and regulations; and for continuing to reform and improve public elementary school programs, secondary school programs, adult education, some preschool programs, and child care programs. The CDE's mission is to provide a world-class education for all students, from early childhood to adulthood. The CDE serves our state by innovating and collaborating with educators, schools, parents, and community partners, preparing students to live, work, and thrive in a highly connected world.

http://www.cde.ca.gov/
Special Requirements
The position(s) require(s) a(n) Registered Dietitian License. You will be required to provide a copy of your license prior to being hired.
Individuals MUST have taken and passed an examination to obtain list eligibility for the classification in order to apply. The examination bulletin(s) may be viewed on the California Department of Education Web page at: Open Examinations - Jobs at CDE (CA Dept of Education)

Dates printed on Mobile Bar Codes, such as the Quick Response (QR) Codes available at the USPS, are not considered Postmark dates for the purpose of determining timely filing of an application.

Who May Apply

SROA and Surplus candidates are given priority; therefore, individuals with other eligibility may be considered in the event no SROA or Surplus candidates apply.

Applications will be screened and only the most qualified applicants will be selected to move forward in the selection process. Applicants must meet the Minimum Qualifications stated in the Classification Specification(s).
How To Apply
Complete Application Packages (including your Examination/Employment Application (STD 678) and applicable or required documents) must be submitted to apply for this Job Posting. Application Packages may be submitted electronically through your CalCareer Account at www.CalCareers.ca.gov. When submitting your application in hard copy, a completed copy of the Application Package listing must be included. If you choose to not apply electronically, a hard copy application package may be submitted through an alternative method listed below:

1430 N Street, Ste. 1802
Sacramento, CA 95814

Department of Education
Attn: C&P PC 2483/JC-409826
1430 N Street (Lobby Drop-Off Box)
Sacramento, CA 95814
08:00 AM - 05:00 PM
Required Application Package Documents
The following items are required to be submitted with your application. Applicants who do not submit the required items timely may not be considered for this job:
Current version of the State Examination/Employment Application STD Form 678 (when not applying electronically), or the Electronic State Employment Application through your Applicant Account at www.CalCareers.ca.gov. All Experience and Education relating to the Minimum Qualifications listed on the Classification Specification should be included to demonstrate how you meet the Minimum Qualifications for the position.
Resume is required and must be included.
Degree and/or School Transcripts
